intro: Stelis agonzalezii, commonly known as the A González Orchid, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Epidendroideae subfamily and is characterized by its delicate, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually long and narrow, and it produces clusters of small, colorful blooms. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in the wild.
